article.headline: West Virginia 66, St. Bonaventure 61
article.story: ROCHESTER, N.Y. (AP) -- Mike Gansey scored 28 points to lead West Virginia to a 66-61 win over St. Bonaventure Wednesday night. St. Bonaventure (2-2) staged an improbable second-half comeback, going on a 21-0 run over an eight-minute span to erase a 45-25 West Virginia lead. Patrick Lottin hit two 3-pointers to pull the Bonnies to 59-58 with two minutes to play. But Gansey clinched the win with four points from the free-throw line with less than 20 seconds left. He also led the Mountaineers (3-3) with nine rebounds, helping end their three-game losing streak. West Virginia's Kevin Pittsnogle sparked a 14-4 run to start the second half with seven of his 20 points. For St. Bonaventure, Michael Lee scored 20 points and Ahmad Smith had 10 rebounds to go with 16 points. The Moutnaineers, ranked No. 13 in both polls last week, fell out of the Top 25 after losses to No. 2 Texas, No. 10 Kentucky and No. 25 LSU.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
